alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 09 at 9:17PM MDT until April 11 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Forecast For Tuesday; Near Record Heat Also Possible... .A very dry and warm air mass looks to develop across the High Plains Tuesday. Due to the prolonged lack of precipitation and multiple days of warm and gusty winds confidence is high enough to at least warrant the issue of a Fire Weather Watch for portions of the area. Temperatures will also be very warm for this time of the year with highs currently forecast in the mid 80s resulting in some record highs for the area. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND GUSTY WINDS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 013, 027, 028, 041, 042, 253, AND 254... * Affected Area...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 253 Kit Carson and Fire Weather Zone 254 Cheyenne. In Kansas, Fire Weather Zone 013 Sherman, Fire Weather Zone 027 Wallace, Fire Weather Zone 028 Logan, Fire Weather Zone 041 Greeley and Fire Weather Zone 042 Wichita. * Winds...South 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * Relative Humidity...Around 10 percent. * Temperatures...In the lower to mid 80s. * Impacts...Any fires that start will have extreme fire behavior and spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not advised.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
